overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have not publicly expressed any clear stance on development (each is marked as "unknown" stance). None hold public office or prominent civic positions; two are private landowners with low community influence, while one operates a local well-drilling business and has moderate influence in local networks.

neighbors.name: Peggy A. Stoll
neighbors.claims: Peggy A. Stoll is a landowner in Cochise County, identified as the owner of parcel 106-03-044 in a rural tax district ([parcelinquiry.azurewebsites.us](https://parcelinquiry.azurewebsites.us/Reporting/TaxBill?parcelNumber=4035432604&taxYear=2025#:~:text=CC%20COCHISE%20COUNTY%203,9326)). Her name does not appear in county lists of local officials or public filings, suggesting she holds no official role ([cochise.az.gov](https://cochise.az.gov/Archive.aspx#:~:text=Archive%20Center%20%E2%80%A2%20Cochise%20County%2C,PDF)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach her individually and listen to any concerns. Emphasize respect for her rural lifestyle (privacy, quiet) and explain how the project will minimally impact her property.

neighbors.name: Michael E. Klein & Peggy Klein
neighbors.claims: Michael E. Klein and Peggy Klein jointly own a rural parcel in Cochise County (PIN 106-06-021D) ([parcelinquiry.azurewebsites.us](https://parcelinquiry.azurewebsites.us/Reporting/TaxBill?parcelNumber=4035432604&taxYear=2025#:~:text=CC%20COCHISE%20COUNTY%203,9326)). No record of the Kleins engaging in local civic activities or voicing opinions on development was found in public news or county archives ([archive.ph](https://archive.ph/2026.01.06-175538/https%3A/www.myheraldreview.com/free_access/letter-where-are-cochise-countys-concerned-citizens/article_dffca578-c4f6-4e4b-ac2f-4a56640b176d.html#:~:text=Benson%20residents%20are%20fighting%20hard,health%2C%20economy%2C%20and%20shared%20environment)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet with the Kleins together in a conversational setting. Highlight how the development plans will protect their land use and property value, addressing any questions they have about local impacts.

neighbors.name: Zane Daniel Ritenour & Carina Marie Ritenour
neighbors.claims: Zane and Carina Ritenour are affiliated with B-J Drilling Company Inc., a water well drilling and service business based in Cochise County ([wellowner.org](https://wellowner.org/contractor/b-j-drilling-company-inc/#:~:text=,Zane%20Ritenour)). Zane Ritenour is listed as the qualifying party on the company’s Arizona well drilling license (ROC categories R-53 and A-4, active through 2025) ([app.azwater.gov](https://app.azwater.gov/WellRegistry/Detail.aspx?RegID=513420#:~:text=Active%20License%20A%20,2017)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Ritenours by acknowledging their water expertise. Discuss the project’s groundwater protection measures in detail and highlight opportunities for local contractors, which may appeal to their professional interests.
